message.content:
cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.EC, cs.DS, cs.MA. 

This paper deals with mechanism design, which is a subfield of game theory. Specifically, it focuses on the family of Groves mechanisms, which is a well-known topic in algorithmic game theory. Therefore, cs.GT (Game Theory and Mechanism Design) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the efficiency and strategy-proofness of the mechanisms, which are important considerations in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper deals with budget balance, which is a topic in economics and computational social choice (cs.EC). The paper also introduces measures for comparing mechanisms, which is a topic in decision theory and optimization (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the maximal elements of the partial orders induced by these measures, which is a topic in multi-agent systems (cs.MA).
